author: olshansky
content:
Thanks for the intro <@578356786889752586>!

At the moment, you can think of Pocket as a decentralized RPC protocol that incentivizes full nodes through tokenomic incentives; network stats at https://poktscan.com/.

I do think it's important that we incentivize serving light client data too. Ethereum is just one "chain ID", so if it's a simple JSON RPC call that's part of the RPC spec [1], it should be handled transparently. If it depends on the client implementation, and not exposed by every client, then would need to be a protocol level separation between different ETH clients and the problem becomes less trivial.

Will reach out to <@178652431868100609> directly as well to discuss in more detail.

[1] https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/
[2] https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/nodes-and-clients/#execution-clients
